entry.title: Mallard II (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the wooden-hulled Mallard II (pictured), built in 1936, is "probably the oldest operating dredge in California"?

entry.title: Hanne Nielsen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Danish dairy farmer Hanne Nielsen created a Tilsit cheese for King Christian IX of Denmark?

entry.title: WBAW (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that South Carolina radio station WBAW received a Peabody Award for public-service programming just six months after signing on the air?

entry.title: Jack G. Downing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jack G. Downing, the only person to serve as CIA station chief in Moscow and Beijing, "read Chinese poetry for kicks"?

entry.title: English Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to campus legend, the English Building at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign is haunted by the ghost of a female student who drowned in the building's pool?

entry.title: Andreas Schnider (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Andreas Schnider, a theologian and local Austrian People's Party leader from Graz, holds a leading role in Austria's teacher training?

entry.title: Beddomeia waterhouseae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the range of freshwater snail Beddomeia waterhouseae consists merely of a small tributary in Tasmania?

entry.title: prime minister of Zambia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the time the post was abolished, the prime minister of Zambia was being paid less than his secretary?
